line: File ownership has been an issue in a number of recent complaints before the Trans-Tasman
label: paragraph

line: IP Attorneys Board (the Board). This Practice Note is published by the Board to assist
label: paragraph

line: registered attorneys to understand their obligations
label: paragraph

line: AFT and may change from time to time.
label: paragraph

line: Responsibilities of registered attorneys
label: heading

line: The Board expects that registered patent attorneys and registered trade marks attorneys
label: paragraph

line: (collectively, 'registered attorneys') should maintain a file in such a manner that the client’s
label: paragraph

line: property is, or can be, readily identified. This will allow the attorney to promptly comply with
label: paragraph

line: a request for the return of the client’s property if and when it is made.
label: paragraph

line: Legislative requirements
label: heading

line: The Code of Conduct for Trans-Tasman Patent and Trade Marks Attorneys 2018 (the Code)
label: paragraph

line: deals generally with the professional conduct required of registered attorneys. Section 25 of
label: paragraph

line: the Code deals with client or former client property, including the return of a client’s property
label: paragraph

line: when the client asks the registered attorney for its return. However, a registered attorney need
label: paragraph

line: not return the client’s property if the client has not satisfied a lien imposed in accordance with
label: paragraph

line: the Patents Regulations 1991 (Cth) or the Trade Marks Regulations 1995 (Cth), or the
label: paragraph

line: Patents Act 2013 (NZ) or otherwise by law.
label: paragraph

line: A registered attorney may claim a lien over client documents if outstanding fees are owing to
label: paragraph

line: the registered attorney.
label: paragraph

line: D
label: paragraph

line: R If a registered attorney is running several files for a client, then the
label: paragraph

line: lien could be applied to all the client's files.
label: paragraph

line: Which parts of these files are client property that need to be released to the client on
label: heading

line: request
label: heading

line: Examples of documents that are client property could include:
label: paragraph

line: documents, samples or other material which are owned by the client;
label: paragraph

line: documents, samples or other material created by the client either prior to or during the
label: paragraph

line: course of the retainer, and given to the registered attorney for the purpose of doing the
label: paragraph

line: work subject to the retainer;
label: paragraph

line: documents prepared by the registered attorney for the benefit of the client;
label: paragraph

line: documents prepared by a third party and sent to the registered attorney other than at
label: paragraph

line: the registered attorney’s expense;
label: paragraph

line: documents brought into existence by a registered attorney who acts only as an agent
label: paragraph

line: for a client for this purpose;
label: paragraph

line: original receipts for payments made on behalf of the client;
label: paragraph

line: communications between the registered attorney, IP offices and third parties;
label: paragraph

line: file notes of telephone conversations relating to the work subject to the retainer;
label: paragraph

line: filing details of a client’s intellectual property rights.
label: paragraph

line: Registered attorneys should note that paragraph 25(1)(b) of the Code provides for the
label: paragraph

line: registered attorney to release ‘documents, samples or material to which the client may have
label: paragraph

line: access under an agreement between the registered attorney and the client’. This category of
label: paragraph

line: documents, etc. will be determined by the nature of the agreement between the client and the
label: paragraph

line: registered attorney, however it should not derogate from the client’s right to the client’s
label: paragraph

line: property. Registered attorneys may seek to clarify these matters in their standard retainer
label: paragraph

line: terms for the avoidance of doubt.
label: paragraph

line: Which parts are not client property
label: heading

line: AFT Examples of documents that are not client property could include:
label: paragraph

line: drafts and office copies of final accounts of profit and loss, balance sheets etc.;
label: paragraph

line: draft and office copies of final reports, memoranda and notes requested by the client;
label: paragraph

line: file copies of client property made at the registered attorney’s expense;
label: paragraph

line: internal cheque requisitions, photocopying requisition forms, etc.;
label: paragraph

line: trust and other accounts printouts;
label: paragraph

line: internal records and memos about work done or to be done.
label: paragraph

line: Can an attorney levy charges, etc. for the extraction, copying and delivery of a client’s
label: heading

line: file (and if so, when)
label: heading

line: R A client should not be charged to copy client property for the retention of a copy by the
label: paragraph

line: registered attorney.
label: paragraph

line: In practice, an attorney should not levy charges for delivery of the client’s property unless the
label: paragraph

line: attorney and client have otherwise agreed. If a charge has been agreed, then it is
label: paragraph

line: recommended that the
label: paragraph

line: D charge reflect the approximate cost to the attorney of making a copy.
label: paragraph

line: In the absence of such an agreement, if a registered attorney were to charge an unreasonable
label: paragraph

line: amount for document storage, extraction, copying or delivery it could be argued that such
label: paragraph

line: conduct is inconsistent with the registered attorney’s obligation to act in the best interests of
label: paragraph

line: the registered attorney’s client.
label: paragraph

line: I f you have any concerns please contact the Secretary, Trans-Tasman IP Attorneys Board.
label: paragraph

line: C ontact details:
label: paragraph

line: Email: mail.ttipab@ipaustralia.gov.au
label: paragraph
